Description: Rim sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of elaborate rosette in added white outline with added red centres; exterior: at rim, band of dots between bands; below, painted decoration consisting of sphinx (wing remaining) to left.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The exterior and interior surfaces of the sherd were burnt during the bombings in London in 1941.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0578) (phase 2)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: ucl np 76 (Other Accession Number)
